title: Fix split-view card border clipping for Map and Table panels

requirements.summary: Ensure Map and Table cards render a continuous, unclipped bottom border and rounded corners in Split view, while remaining correct in Map-only and Table-only views.
acceptanceCriteria: In Split view, neither the Map card nor the Table card has its bottom border (or rounded corners) clipped/cut off.
The fix works at common breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop) without introducing new overflow/scrollbar artifacts.
Map-only view still shows a correct, continuous border around the Map card (including the bottom edge).
Table-only view still shows a correct, continuous border around the Table card and its inner bordered container.

file_operations.description: Adjust Split view panel wrappers so the card borders/rounded corners remain visible (remove clipping/overflow behavior) while still constraining each panel to ~600px height. Ensure both panels use a layout that lets inner content scroll/fit without cutting off the Card border. Leverage the existing shadcn-ui Card composition already used by Map/Table; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update the Map card internal sizing so it can fill a parent-constrained panel height (e.g., Split view) without forcing a fixed inner height that contributes to outer clipping. Keep Map-only view visually unchanged (still ~600px tall), and preserve correct rounded bottom corners and border visibility. Uses shadcn-ui Card; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update the Table card layout so the scroll container can either use the existing 600px max height (Table-only) or fill a parent-constrained panel height (Split view) without overflowing and causing border clipping. Ensure the inner bordered container remains intact and visible. Uses shadcn-ui Card/Table; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Refine Split view container styling in EarthquakeDashboard to avoid any wrapper overflow/fixed-height combinations that clip card borders while keeping ~600px panel height and usability.
acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.tsx`, Split view no longer uses wrapper styles that visually cut off the Card border.
Both panels remain the intended height (approximately 600px) and content remains usable (map visible, table scrollable).

file_operations.description: Replace the current Split view `h-[600px] overflow-hidden` wrappers with a non-clipping panel container approach (still ~600px tall) and wire any new optional sizing props into EarthquakeMapView/EarthquakeResultsTable so map/table content remains usable without cutting off card borders. Leverage existing shadcn-ui Card-based panels; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
